title: 14 - year - old girl selected for World Youth Cup in Sweden
body_text:
A FOOTBALL-MAD teenager has been picked to play in a world-wide competition.
At fourteen years old, Amelie Scott from Tynedale has been selected for the football World Youth Cup in Gothenburg in Sweden in June.
Amelie has been playing football since she was a child and enjoys taking part in many practices during the week.
Speaking about her daughter's passion, Steph Scott said: "Amelie has always been interested in football and is my only child to pursue it as a hobby.
"So a lot of our time is standing at the edge of the pitch lines watching her but we are very proud of her for her commitment to keep doing something she really likes.
"It all began when she decided that one day she was really good at the sport and has not stopped since.
"Currently she attends many football sessions including coaching lessons at PG Coaching in Hexham and is sometimes the only girl - but that does not stop her.
"She takes inspiration from England women's football team who she saw in the Euro Finals last year which she will cherish for the rest of her life.
"Even before then, she met Jill Scott at a training session at Wallsend Boys Club in 2021, which was an amazing opportunity."
Steph then explains how the opportunity to gain a place on the team competing in Sweden.
She said."We were amazed that her name was put her forward and over the moon that she was selected - she has to be a certain level of skill to be put forward.
Speaking about Amelie and her growth, Patrick McAlindon, director of PGS Coaching in Hexham adds: "Amelie has been attending our sessions since we started out in 2019.
"One of our key objectives is to support opportunities for our players within the game, whatever they are seeking to achieve.
"We're really proud of Amelie, who regularly is in the minority at sessions. Her love of the game and determination, as well as her technical ability, always shine through.
"We're proud to be able to support her in her football journey".
